intro: Rhynchospora nervosa var. subfiliformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant features slender, upright stems with narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. This variety is distinguished by its finely veined leaves and elongated, thread-like inflorescences.
